subject: CBS News Sunday Morning: Royal attraction
body:
CBSNews.com












  Home | U.S. | World | Politics | SciTech | Health | Entertainment | Business | Opinion | Sports | Blogs | Interactives | Video 

  The Early Show | CBS Evening News | 48 Hours | 60 Minutes | The Saturday Early Show | CBS Sunday Morning | Face The Nation 






April 27, 2007
 
Later this week, 
      Britain’s Queen Elizabeth takes her show on 
      the road. The 81-year old monarch 
      will pay a visit to the United States -- 
      reason enough for correspondent 
      Mark Phillips to look at the enduring attraction the British royal family 
      has for Americans in this 
      Sunday Morning’s Cover Story.


The 
      Queen plans to visit Jamestown, the first 
      British colony on American soil, now marking its 400th 
      anniversary. And we’ve asked our Joie Chen to pay a visit to Jamestown to tell us 
      about its history.

After 
      that, we’re off to the movies: David Edelstein has a review of the latest 
      reincarnation of Spider-Man, the new film, "Spider-Man 3."

From 
      Serena Altschul this Sunday 
      Morning, an interview with Renee Richards. Time was, she was Dr. Richard Raskind, and her sex 
      change operation forever changed the way Americans perceived what’s come 
      to be known as "gender 
      issues."

Imagine what it’s like to lose 
      your vision at age three. Imagine 
      the obstacles you have to overcome. Now, imagine what it’s like to get your 
      vision back, some 40 
      years later! This Sunday, Mike May tells his remarkable story to 
      correspondent John Blackstone.

Our 
      Mo Rocca tells us what it’s like to appear in a Broadway show, plus a visit to the Baghdad zoo, and more, this Sunday 
      Morning.
Listen for our trumpet!
